caption: Really good place for hot Pho in winter, but I go all year around
Worse pho ever
Super tasty! Ordered pho for takeout. Everything was packaged well. Not skimpy at all on the meat/garnishing. Excellent value, will definitely be coming back. Phonomenal!
The pho is super yummy and the restaurant is very clean. The owner once walked customers in the back to show how clean the restaurant was.  The staff is very nice. This is a family own business.
Slapped
I love this place nice service good food everyone always seem nice definitely will comeback.
Loved !
Best Pho place in town, I’m from WI and visit every time I come to Chicago.

I came in accompanied by my group and I had asked for my pho bowl with the onions separate due to a mental health condition. When the waiter came to take my group’s order I had specifically told her to have it separated and the waiter jokingly said in a translation to English “ you have to remove them yourself”. I was already in a bad mood that day and I wanted to come to the restaurant I haven’t been to in weeks. The way the waitress  discouraged me in front of everyone that knew my condition was insulting. I didn’t laugh initially, but my face and presence showed I was not remotely joking. I’m hundred percent sure that the waiter knew this and still choose to continue taking orders without an apology. My appetite was disgustingly ruined. I now have a hard time looking at the dish I’ve come to love in my culture and now can never forget that moment now so that’s why I’m writing this review. I believe the next insulting part that followed was...I never got the dam onions or scallions on the side. It was so bland to have it without it and I was having a bad day so I just ate the pho as fast as I could and left the group since someone already volunteered to pay. When the waiter came I asked about why I didn’t have the onion or scallions on the side and she said she thought I didn’t want them when I clearly instructed her to have it on the side before she made that horrific joke.mi stormed out the building in anger and went home. I honestly hoped that restaurant was gonna help me, but I can’t help but feel a pain in my chest and a tear to my eyes every time I think back to the moment where the waiter made a mean joke and still disregarded my easy instructions. My departure should’ve been a sign for the waiter to realize what happened, but of course it’s not. The reason why my review rating is a 2/5 is because I still want to believe in the restaurant I’ve come to enjoy, maybe it’s because I’ve visited so many times and loved the dishes. I don’t review often, but I felt like I needed to get this off my chest. I hope the owners can tell their staff to be careful about what they say because you don’t know if your joke can impact someone you don’t know who may be having a bad time. I honestly want to go back to talk to the waiter and the owner, but my fears and depression makes me lose heart every time I pass the restaurant. It’s a sinking feeling I can never let go even when I recently visited another pho restaurant (pho5lua), the waiter saw I wasn’t enjoying the pho and talked to me about it. I truly feel that I can never enjoy a good pho meal anymore because of that experience, and I hope my review will help people tell the waiter or manager of my experience because my heart isn’t strong enough.
Delicious food
First time here and very happy with everything. The Pbo Chay (vegetarian rice noodle soup with vegetables) was so filling, they didn't skimp on the portions.
Got it (pho) delivered and it was very good. Good portion. Nice and neat packaging. Plenty of extra garnishes, vegetables etc. I'll be sure to visit when restaurants open up after covid
(Translated by Google) Can eat  (Original) Ăn Được
Good food, close to the train station.

Good pho! The pho is authentic and flavorful. Other items on the menu such pork chop rice is also good and served in a giant portion. The banh cuon was good and fresh, with paper thin crepe and good stuffing. Expect no service. Street parking is available and plenty.
Really tasty pho!
Very good  service and great presentation on the  food and very fresh cuisine
Best pho and cat fish, plus one of the few places you can get regular Vietnamese plus crab. Going there tonight!
Favorite pho in the city!

I think their pho is one of the best in the city. Always consistent and for the price you are getting alot of food.  Tried the bahn mi and that was on point as well.  If you like pho definitely worth stopping by

An awesome service with beautiful and cozy interior design. Was out of nation for working and visited this place to enjoy the original taste of country. Love Com Tam (Broken rice with grilled pork) and Pho in here. Bun Ca and Bun Nuoc Leo Soc Trang are both amazing as well! I hope I have some photos here but since enjoying food to much that I forgot to take some. Absolutely will revisit it if I have a chance to back there!
Good hangover food
(Translated by Google) Very good  (Original) Muy bueno
(Translated by Google) Rico that poh  (Original) Rico ese poh
Delicious!
Good food. Legit Flavor !
Excellent 🍜

3/5 Pho 0/5 service 0/5 seating We were seated at table 1, right by the door. Our food was great and arrived perfectly on time, but they didn't check up on us after that. After  20 minutes, I decided to pay the bill. They are pretty sketchy as they tried getting me to leave the tip section blank when you sign on the reciept, which would in turn be a blank check for them to tip themselves.  Customers beware!
Fresh foods. Fast service. OK portion.
PHO SHO! (canned mushrooms in the vegi pho tho) update: get the thin sliced beef pho, and get a size small. The large is a bathtub.
Nice little place good service.
Great vermicelli salads
Love this place. Great food and atmosphere. Always come out full and satisfied.

(Translated by Google) Vietnamese food very delicious and authentic! Braised fish, sour fish soup is delicious!  (Original) Vietnamese food very delicious and authentic  ! Cá kho tộ, canh chua cá rất ngon!
Pho is good here...
The best food money can buy

Very Good, The PHO soup was great. I love freshly cooked shrimp fried rice where each item is at the same temperature makes it even better. Was eager to eat on the way home in the to-go containers, but i ended up dropping it. Came right back the next day for another, PHO SOUP. VERY GOOD FOOD, for my date and i. 🙏
the shrimp bowl is so good what the heck I’m in love. Literally what I’m excited for everytime I go to Chicago. Like I stan sis.

This place is amazing. Growing up and eating authentic pho all the time, I’m really picky and good at differentiating between bad and good quality pho. This place in particular is probably the best pho I’ve had in Chicago. The broth is hearty and tasty. I usually order pho with everything in it including; tripe, tendons, beef, meat balls, and what I love most about it is that they give you a cervical spinal cord attached with meat still. That is authentic af.  One thing I will say is that I usually order egg rolls as an appetizer and they aren’t really consistent with it. The egg rolls are frozen and they just deep fry them as preparation. Which means, your egg rolls aren’t always as hot. I’ve had times where I’ve bitten into it and there’s still small shards of ice in it. Its not really a big deal tho because your server will just send it back and make you another. Other than that, when it is perfectly fried, it’s amazing.  There is free WiFi as well and the atmosphere is good. No complaints. Just sit, eat, and enjoy the pho!
Cozy place to eat out. Friendly staff and decent Vietnamese cuisine restaurant.

Don't let Pho Loan's shoddy menu filled with low and high-res pictures of their products fool you into thinking that the place serves poor quality food. That was what I did and I couldn't be more wrong about the place. The food was good, the vegetables were good, the prices could be better, and the portions were good. The place is very tiny as well  My only real complaint about the place was that my waiter ended up forgetting about two of my orders--an entree that had apparently been sitting in the kitchen waiting to be put out along with a smoothie. As soon as I had informed him about my smoothie, he replied with a, "Oh, yes. Your smoothie..it's coming right now" and I kid you not a few seconds later I hear the blender revving up. What a little brat
Many dishes in here are pretty good.
Great pho!  Just like homemade and they will make it to your specification
Tasty and plentiful food. Fresh, flavorful. A terrific value. Order the large option and split with a friend.
(Translated by Google) Com suon Ngon Dac biet  (Original) Com suon   Ngon   Dac  biet
Absolutely the best pho i have ever had. And the shrimp fried rice is AMAZING. I hope they never change and there food stays so tasty!!!!
Food is sucked, expensive, Bun Bo Hue taste like sugar cane
Absolutely delicious!!!

Came with my family looking to try a new pho place on argyle.... Very poor service. The brought one incorrect dish and MADE us take it. Also missed one of our orders. On top of that the pho broth is so so sweet, along with everything else that the rest of us ordered. I recommend walking right past this place to any number of delicious pho spots in the neighborhood.
Lots of great pho on argyle.  Pho loan is one of the best

Come to the restaurant on a Sunday evening after a long day haven't eaten anything. In very good mood looking for good food, I ordered Bun Bo Hue. After 15 minutes waiting the food came out. OOOPS... Good mood totally shut down to the freaking mood :(( the soup tastes like water. I had to add a lot of fish sauce and chili sauce in order to make it more tasty. Totally disappointed. No recommend if you are looking for authentic Bun Bo Hue. From now on I am gonna cross this place out of my favorite Vietnamese restaurant list.
Great pho here! We are long time customer and will be coming back again and again.

The Pho here is so good. I like it much better than other places I've tried. The pho come in small or large sizes but the small is a bowl size you'd get as the normal order at any other restaurant. The large is enough to have leftovers for the next day. The staff is very nice. My friend and I drive up from the south side just to eat at this cozy restaurant.
Amazing, authentic Vietnamese Pho.  Huge portions at great prices.  Also a wide variety of menu items if you don't want Pho.  HIGHLY recommend.  5-stars.
This place is a gem.
Always the most fresh ingredients here. One of the best Pho places in the city.
Phenomenal noodle soups (pho, bum bo hue, Bun rie, etc). Best place for teaditional rice paper wraps dishes with meats and vegetables you make on your own

This was our 1st time there and it will be our last. The guy that took our order was very rude. Our food came out at different times. The food was ok at best. Even though you could tell that we were done eating they didn't bring my check until I signaled them.
You have to wait at least 30 min to get your food
Com Tam (#85) is my favorite here!
Good food, service needs to improve a little bit
Their pho is alright, probably a bit disappointing if you're looking for something amazing.
The service was awful, especially the guy with no smile on his face. He was so danm rude. Food was good but wouldn't come back again.

This place can be such a hit or miss, which is unfortunate because my family loved this place and went nearly every weekend. On a good day, you'll have amazingly fresh pho and great portions. On a bad day, it'll be watered down, skimpy and greasy.  As other reviewers have said, the service can also be lacking. There's usually at least three bus boys for a smaller restaurant but it seems so mismanaged. Tables are half cleaned, food comes out at an illogical pace and expect to wait a bit anytime you ask them for something.
High quality large bowl of Bun Thit Nuong and spring rolls. Nice small restaurant and good service.
Good Pho.
This is best taste Pho restaurant in town, especially the file Pho (number#10 in menu). My family check out this every weekend, the price is also good, $9/bowl

i am new in Chicago and i tried to find vietnamese traditional food. it was amazing when i had chance to eat Pho Filet in Pho Loan. it seems that everything made me satisfied such as delicous food, friendly waitress/waitor, clean restaurant...  i will recommend my classmates to come and try soon!!!
So Good!!
Kind service. Delicious Viet Cuisine

I stopped by and got 2 bahn mi sandwiches to go. The first was good, grilled pork, jalapeno's, etc. Then I got halfway through the second when I quickly ate something small then my mouth immediately caught on fire. My tongue and lips turned beat red, it wasn't just hot it was excruciating pain. My heart started racing, my nose wouldn't stop running, I got a bad headache, I was sweating like crazy.. I was actually worried I might have to go to the ER. That was a habanero pepper, nothing else could have caused that. That was NOT mentioned in the description, or any pepper even. And it can be seriously dangerous for some people to eat those who are not used to super spicy food. I would not recommend this place to anyone!
Authentic vietnamese delights, filling, and reasonable.
Great and super yummy Asian food!  Highly recommended!
Newer noodle shop on Argyle with many seafood options

Pho Loan use the freshest ingredients and the most aromatic spices to create each dish. More importantly, our food is made with tender loving care. One taste of our food and your mind will journey to the flavorful aromas along the bustling streets of Vietnam. We hope that you will experience our love of food in each and every meal.
